 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (AttributeSet)

Detailed Description

A collection of attributes, as found associated with a tag in an XML document.

Often you will not want to use this interface directly, instead passing it to Theme::obtainStyledAttributes(AttributeSet, int[], int, int)

which will take care of parsing the attributes for you. In particular, the Resources API will convert resource references (attribute values such as "@string/my_label" in the original XML) to the desired type for you; if you use AttributeSet directly then you will need to manually check for resource references (with getAttributeResourceValue(int, int)) and do the resource lookup yourself if needed. Direct use of AttributeSet also prevents the application of themes and styles when retrieving attribute values.

This interface provides an efficient mechanism for retrieving data from compiled XML files, which can be retrieved for a particular XmlPullParser through Xml::asAttributeSet . Normally this will return an implementation of the interface that works on top of a generic XmlPullParser, however it is more useful in conjunction with compiled XML resources:

 XmlPullParser parser = resources.getXml(myResouce);
 AttributeSet attributes = Xml.asAttributeSet(parser);

The implementation returned here, unlike using the implementation on top of a generic XmlPullParser, is highly optimized by retrieving pre-computed information that was generated by aapt when compiling your resources. For example, the getAttributeFloatValue(int, float) method returns a floating point number previous stored in the compiled resource instead of parsing at runtime the string originally in the XML file.

This interface also provides additional information contained in the compiled XML resource that is not available in a normal XML file, such as getAttributeNameResource(int) which returns the resource identifier associated with a particular XML attribute name.

virtual int32_t gaia::core::AttributeSet::getAttributeNameResource ( int32_t  index) [virtual]

Return the resource ID associated with the given attribute name.

This will be the identifier for an attribute resource, which can be used by styles. Returns 0 if there is no resource associated with this attribute.

Note that this is different than getAttributeResourceValue in that it returns a resource identifier for the attribute name; the other method returns this attribute's value as a resource identifier.

Parameters:
indexIndex of the desired attribute, 0...count-1.
Returns:
The resource identifier, 0 if none.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::AttributeSet::getAttributeResourceValue ( const gaia::base::String &  strnamespace,
const gaia::base::String &  attribute,
int32_t  defaultValue 
) [virtual]

Return the value of 'attribute' as a resource identifier.

Note that this is different than getAttributeNameResource in that it returns a the value contained in this attribute as a resource identifier (i.e., a value originally of the form "@package:type/resource"); the other method returns a resource identifier that identifies the name of the attribute.

Parameters:
strnamespaceNamespace of attribute to retrieve.
attributeThe attribute to retrieve.
defaultValueWhat to return if the attribute isn't found.
Returns:
Resulting value.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::AttributeSet::getAttributeResourceValue ( int32_t  index,
int32_t  defaultValue 
) [virtual]

Note that this is different than getAttributeNameResource in that it returns a the value contained in this attribute as a resource identifier (i.e., a value originally of the form "@package:type/resource"); the other method returns a resource identifier that identifies the name of the attribute.

Parameters:

defaultValueWhat to return if the attribute isn't found.

Resulting value.

The lookup is performed using the attribute name.

virtual gaia::base::String gaia::core::AttributeSet::getClassAttribute ( ) [virtual]

Return the value of the "class" attribute or null if there is not one.

Equivalent to getAttributeValue(null, "class").

Returns:
The class attribute's value or null.
virtual gaia::base::String gaia::core::AttributeSet::getIdAttribute ( ) [virtual]

Returns:
The id attribute's value or null.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::AttributeSet::getIdAttributeResourceValue ( int32_t  defaultValue) [virtual]

Return the integer value of the "id" attribute or defaultValue if there is none.

Equivalent to getAttributeResourceValue(null, "id", defaultValue);

Parameters:
defaultValueWhat to return if the "id" attribute isn't found.
Returns:
int32_t Resulting value.
virtual gaia::base::String gaia::core::AttributeSet::getPositionDescription ( ) [virtual]

Returns a description of the current position of the attribute set.

For instance, if the attribute set is loaded from an XML document, the position description could indicate the current line number.

Returns:
A string representation of the current position in the set, may be null.
virtual int32_t gaia::core::AttributeSet::getStyleAttribute ( ) [virtual]

Return the value of the "style" attribute or 0 if there is not one.

Equivalent to getAttributeResourceValue(null, "style").

Returns:
The style attribute's resource identifier or 0.
